title: X-Travel: Global Mobility Matrix
subtitle: Optimizing the Human Experience Vector. First Principles.

globalSensorArray.name: Global Sensor Array
globalSensorArray.details: Ingests raw, unstructured data streams from everything: market fluctuations, weather patterns, social vectors, traffic physics. The system's senses.

dataRefinery.name: Data Refinery
dataRefinery.details: A massive ETL pipeline that cleans, structures, and vectorizes raw data into usable information for The Core. The boring but critical part.

itineraryPrime.name: Itinerary Prime
itineraryPrime.details: The central intelligence. A singular, powerful transformer model that processes all refined data to understand the state of the world and the user's utility function.

userVectorDB.name: User Utility Function DB
userVectorDB.details: Stores the mathematical representation of each user's preferences, constraints, and predicted desires. This is what Prime optimizes for.

futureSimEngine.name: Future Simulation Engine
futureSimEngine.details: Generates millions of potential trip-futures based on a user's goal, then runs them through a physics-based simulation to predict outcomes and resource cost.

optimizer.name: Optimizer
optimizer.details: Scores every simulated future against the user's utility function and global constraints. It discards all but the single, mathematically optimal itinerary.

actuatorFleet.name: Actuator Fleet
actuatorFleet.details: A swarm of autonomous software agents that execute the chosen itinerary. They book flights, cars, tables, and interface with legacy systems via the Bridge.

legacyBridge.name: Legacy System Bridge
legacyBridge.details: API gateway to all external, third-party systems. To be phased out over time through vertical integration.

neuralInterface.name: Neural Interface
neuralInterface.details: The minimalist, high-bandwidth interface for the user to state goals and receive the single, optimized plan. For now, it's an app. Eventually, it won't be.
